snippet: As Congress searches for a budget deal, one unrelated issue keeps coming up: a tax on the sale of medical devices, enacted to help finance the health care law.
abstract: In Practice column; tax on sale of medical devices like heart implants and artificial hips, enacted to help finance health care law, is becoming recurring theme in budget debate as Congress searches for deal to end standoff.

byline.original: By ERIC LIPTON and BARRY MEIER

lead_paragraph: As Congress searches for a budget deal, one unrelated issue keeps coming up: a tax on the sale of medical devices, enacted to help finance the health care law.

headline.main: Tax on Medical Devices Becomes Recurring Theme in Budget Debate
headline.print_headline: Tax on Medical Devices Becomes Recurring Theme in Budget Debate

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
